verses.verse: You have made us a strife to our neighbors, And our enemies laugh among themselves.
Restore us, O God of hosts; Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
You have brought ((Is. 5:1, 7); Jer. 2:21; Ezek. 15:6; 17:6; 19:10) a vine out of Egypt; (Ps. 44:2; Acts 7:45) You have cast out the nations, and planted it.
You prepared room for it, And caused it to take deep root, And it filled the land.
The hills were covered with its shadow, And the mighty cedars with its (Lev. 23:40) boughs.
She sent out her boughs to the Sea, And her branches to the River.
Why have You (Is. 5:5; Nah. 2:2) broken down her hedges, So that all who pass by the way pluck her fruit?
The boar out of the woods uproots it, And the wild beast of the field devours it.
Return, we beseech You, O God of hosts; (Is. 63:15) Look down from heaven and see, And visit this vine
And the vineyard which Your right hand has planted, And the branch that You made strong ((Is. 49:5)) for Yourself.
It is burned with fire, it is cut down; ((Ps. 39:11)) They perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.
(Ps. 89:21) Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, Upon the son of man whom You made strong for Yourself.
Then we will not turn back from You; Revive us, and we will call upon Your name.
Restore us, O LORD God of hosts; Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
(An Appeal for Israelâ€™s Repentance) To the Chief Musician. (Ps. 8:title) On an instrument of Gath. A Psalm of Asaph. [1] Sing aloud to God our strength; Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob.
Raise a song and strike the timbrel, The pleasant harp with the lute.
